greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of sets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet such that within each word every letter of the alphabet is at least as frequent as the subsequent alphabet letter; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(t=1, 1/n!,
h:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
add(h(n-i*j, i-1, k)*binomial(g(i, k), j), j=0..n/i)))
mathematica: h[n_, i_, k_] := h[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[h[n - i*j, i - 1, k]*Binomial[g[i, k], j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
A[n_, k_] := h[n, n, Min[n, k]];
Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten(* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 02 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 23 2017
